properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 16 at 5:29AM CST until January 16 at 7:30AM CST by NWS Fort Worth TX
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a

* Flood Advisory for...
Southeastern Tarrant County in north central Texas...

* Until 730 AM CST.

* At 526 AM CST, Doppler radar and rain gauges indicated
thunderstorms continued to produce heavy rainfall between I-35W
near downtown Fort Worth and Southeast Loop 820 in Forth Worth.
Automated rain gauges in the area have already reported nearly 2
inches of rain in the last hour. Excessive runoff from these
thunderstorms will cause urban and small stream flooding. Areas
that are low lying or usually experience poor drainage are most
likely to experience flooding. This means some low water crossings
may become impassable.
properties.instruction:
Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as
well as other drainage areas and low lying spots.
